keyTakeAways: A man named Billy Joe Cagle, a convicted felon from Cartersville, Georgia, planned to shoot up the world’s busiest airport, Hartsfield-Jackson Atlanta International Airport, as revealed in a social media livestream.
Cagle was identified by his family who alerted law enforcement after noticing concerning social media posts, which prompted a tip that led to his arrest.
He was found in possession of an AR-15 assault rifle and 27 rounds of ammunition in a Chevrolet pickup truck outside the airport terminal.
Cagle was arrested at the airport after being approached by police using a photo provided by his family; body-cam footage shows him yelling during the arrest.
He has been charged with making terroristic threats, criminal attempt to commit aggravated assault, possession of a firearm during the commission of a felony, and possession of a firearm by a felon.
Law enforcement confirmed that Cagle was not legally authorized to possess the firearm, and federal authorities are investigating how he acquired it.
Cagle has a history of mental health struggles, including schizophrenia, and has known connections in the community who expressed concern over his well-being.
The incident underscores the importance of community vigilance and the role of family members in preventing violent acts through early intervention.

summaryOfNewsArticle: A 49-year-old convicted felon from Cartersville, Georgia, Billy Joe Cagle, was arrested at Hartsfield-Jackson Atlanta International Airport after his family alerted police to a social media livestream in which he reportedly planned to 'shoot it up' at the airport. Officers found an AR-15 rifle and 27 rounds of ammunition in his Chevrolet pickup truck parked outside the terminal. Cagle, who had a history of mental health issues including schizophrenia, was apprehended after arriving at the airport and walking toward the TSA checkpoint. He was charged with terroristic threats, attempted aggravated assault, and unlawful firearm possession. The incident was averted thanks to early community vigilance, with family members and acquaintances raising concerns. Law enforcement confirmed he was not legally allowed to possess the firearm, and federal authorities are investigating its origin. The story highlights the importance of public awareness, mental health support, and timely intervention in preventing violence.
